Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picante Pizza slice. Ohhhhmyyyy Ricottttta

tZTKKms0Ym7k9CIJOmyrDQ.text: This place is pretty awesome. It's trying too hard to be cool. And it wants to be a hipster party place while still being a restaurant and family-friendly-ish. And, of course, the cocktails are overpriced. But the decor is actually neat. And the ambiance and vibe are enjoyable. It's fun for drinks and a slice on a Friday night. And it's chill and hip for brunch on a Sunday early afternoon. But the most important thing...the pizza is fabulously tasty. The basic margherita pizza is a winner. Just order that standard pizza pie and leave satisfied.

8R7CoVeesbZ5ZafxhlU94g.text: Reservations suggested (to avoid long waits). Pizza is fantastic. Service is mediocre. Water is TERRIBLE! (las vegas tap water is absolutely gross, and I am pretty sure they serve a nice glass of tap) being local, we love to take out of town guests to the down town location as it is in close proximity to a lot of fun activites and sights (container park, gold spike, fremont street, hogs n heffers)  The atmosphere is casual, there is a large semi in the dining area. Several televisions broadcasting sports. Drinks are a little steep (for down town)  In the front of the down town location there is a pizza to go bar, where you can order by the slice.  I live the cal italia, new  Personally i love the calnitalia. New yorker and old chicago.  Overall, i recommend Pizza Rock for a casual pizza joint.

rPveHHJPcCqBsnZ0BwYwzQ.text: First off, the pizza here is GOOD. The best I've had in Vegas (so far, because my pizza quest is never ending). Here's the thing, I only ordered a very simple pie - cheese & pep - and loved every single bite. Sure did eat a regular sized pie all by myself. No shame. Judge me if you want to, but that pizza brought out my inner Ninja Turtle.  The beer slection was okie dokie... there are a few craft selections that I would've liked to see - but hey, it's Vegas and the craft beer scene is still developing. Plus side is that there were quite a few selections that I wasn't familiar with, so I got to try something new and enjoyed it!   The atmosphere was interesting... I found it enjoyable to watch the music videos and comedy sketches on the various screens located throughout the restaurant. Kind of noisy - so soft talkers may want to speak up. The decor was... all over, honestly. There's  a friggin semi truck front in there! I like how all of the staff has a rock/punk look & vibe.   "Well if everything was so good and you enjoyed yourself, why not give it 5 stars?!"   Firstly, I can't name this the best, yet. This may not be as good as it gets...that's the feeling it left me - fantastic, but maybe there's  phenomenal out there.   Secondly, the host stand kinda jacked that last star, man. There was a nice little crowd in Pizza Rock during our visit, so we were on a wait... no big. They asked for our number to text us when a table became available. About 20 minutes after our quoted wait, I watched two parties, who had arrived and gave their names after us (we were standing near the host stand the entire time) get seated before us. Maybe they had reservations...maybe they had checked in earlier... I wasn't  sure so we went up to ask about how much longer. Neither of the previous mentioned situations were the case - we had just been forgotten. Womp, womp. So be sure to keep an eye on the hosts or you'll  be standing around hungry with the scent of delicious pizza taunting you.  Maybe next time Pizza Rock can get that 5th star from me. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten... but the classic pepperoni with extra pepperoni.

yTzkdcu8cP2a7Bq1VrnDFA.text: I've been to Pizza Rock twice, and both times were great. Their pizzas are clearly winning awards for a reason! We got the Cal Italia (Asiago, Mozzarella, Gorgonzola, Fig, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano, & Balsamic) the first time, and the La Regina (Sopressata Picante, Proscuitto de Parma, Mozzarella, Provola, Parmaigiano, Piave, Arugula) the second. Both pizzas were really delicious. The La Regina is big, with a delicious thick crust; we shared one pizza between four of us and didn't quite finish it.   Fun atmosphere, great pizza, huge beer list -- I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!

oUmB0jnb3MlmOWdKuzhR9Q.text: Let's just say their staff and this includes their manager need some people skills. We went there one day for lunch to celebrate my co-workers birthday. We chose this spot because they have gluten free pizzas and my co-worker can't eat gluten. We arrive and the restaurant is semi busy but nothing crazy for St. Patty's day. We ordered three pizzas, one pepperoni pizza, one gluten free vegetarian pizza and a MARGHERITA pizza (one of the house specialties). First thing, the place wasn't busy. Let's make note of that. Secondly and this is a pet peeve of mines especially since I come from the hospitality industry, our server did not write our orders down. PEOPLE!!! I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH, UNLESS YOU HAVE OVER 10 YEARS OF RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE THEN YOU BETTER BE WRITING DOWN ORDERS. And here's why...first pizza out was the pepperoni, 10 mins later the vegetarian pizza comes out. 10 mins later, we're still waiting for our pizza. We flag down our server and tell him that our pizza has yet to arrive. Before even checking to see what the status was on our pizza he says it'll be out soon and that's due to the restaurant being busy. So we wait, and wait, and wait. The guys have already eaten their pizza and the vegetarian is about half way through and still nothing. We flag him down again and he goes to look and claims someone walked off with our pizza. Yeah right. Keep in mind, there is no sorry yet. So we ask to see a manager. She comes by claims that she was just told this and she will have it out soon. and she will comp it off the bill? Not a sorry or anywhere near it. Any good manager would know to always apologize to the guest after hearing how their staff messed up a table. We kept telling her that we've been waiting and the server hadn't really down a good job but all she kept saying was I was just told this. By this time yes the restaurant had picked up but there was no way our pizza would have been overlook had the server stayed on his tables. He would have seen that pizzas were missing and he should have gone to the kitchen and asked them right away what the status was on our food and then gone back to check on it.   On the plus side, food was delish and they had a semi truck inside the restaurant but with all that bad service that's not enough to encourage a visit anytime soon.

rxMy-uqWEC6Qx7VccAFj0w.text: Holy Toledo Batman!  This pizza ROCKS!  (Pun intended)  Get the full pie to get the full freshness.  We had the New Yorker and it was so freaking good I will be dreaming of this place when we go home.  The ingredients taste fresh and are plentiful. We ate outside and enjoyed the great seating and adorable appeal downtown has now since its been under reconstruction.  The inside has plenty of seating too but we are loving this weather so we thought outside would be best for us.  I would eat here again and again if we lived here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor seating in the newly renovated downtown VEGAS  right outside of Pizza Rock. We enjoyed our pizza here
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Yorker YUMMMMMY!!

vdPZOKBhLhjlxJp-MzbBgQ.text: it is located in downtown Las Vegas on 3rd street. Parking is difficult but the best option is to park at one of the casinos. The decor and atmosphere were casual with dim lights, DJ played rock music from a walled-in real truck (pretty cool) and multiple TV screens. There were four of us and we stopped in for a bite as it was late night and not too hungry. We ordered Downtown Pizza that has mozzarella, pepperoni, molinari salami, and bacon. The portion is big and was cooked perfectly, not too salty.  The price is pretty decent for the portion.  The server was attentive and made sure the drinks were full. I will be back to try the other things on the menu.

LZcmO1pwT9dJMedRD82yWw.text: This is my absolute favorite pizza place in Vegas. I'm in Vegas a lot for work, and always make sure to top by Pizza Rock. Try their speciality pizzas, especially the one with balsamic dressing, you won't be disappointed.

K2jhirZHAfGM9IGkoxNtcw.text: Loved the pizza! Was skeptical, but gave it a try. The slices are HUGE!. I had plain cheese, just wasn't in the mood for anything more. My friend had two pieces - vegetarian and a meat pizza. They have a walk-up window on the street, a counter where you can order a slice and sit inside and eat it (this is what we did) and they have a restaurant where you can sit. The service was great and so was the pizza. If you like a dry pizza (no oil) then this might not be for you, b ut it was the awesome crust and the olive oil that did it for me. Every once in a while - WTF! Screw the Calories! -  just eat a great slice of pizza. I was glad I did.   Note: it is an easy one block walk from the walking mall area in old town Las Vegas.   8/31/14

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian pizza
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ARinqV4jpuvGjzk8GwSNTQ.text: I first came to Pizza Rock without fully understanding the hype around it. I briefly looked it up when I checked in, but I mostly just went with the recommendation of my friend that suggested that we "had" to go to downtown to try it out.   We strolled in one Sunday afternoon and ordered the Margherita and the All Meat pizzas. Both pizzas were flavorful and fresh tasting, and the All Meat was presented without having a lot of grease that one might expect with an All Meat pizza. This spot would definitely worth coming back if in the area with a craving for pizza and a great ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried green beans.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. garlic bread.

OjP0TdTjXsfdH7vGe3ZIYQ.text: This was like the best lunch I've had in a while.  The pizza was so good!  We ordered a salad to share and garlic bread on top of our pizza.  Mmmmm!  I'm so happy to find out that the same chef has a restaurant in North Beach in San Francisco.  Woot woot!  So going there.  Pizza Rock is very hip and fun to be inside.  They have a great selection of rock songs playing in the background.  Dark decor to fit the theme.  And wonderful service.  Even though there is a place in SF, I'll still go to Pizza Rock again next time I'm in  Vegas because it was such a great experience.  Bonus the Vegas location is cheaper.

-c2sucbuVnJcKIRC17bLig.text: LOUD MUSIC!!!  That's pretty much what I remember from my recent trip here. Eight of us came to celebrate a friend's birthday, but it wasn't a great place to talk to everyone and catch up. We were literally yelling just to talk to person next to us. I think by the end of the meal we all gave up on talking to each other and just stared at the TVs playing music videos instead. In general the whole restaurant is very loud, but I think we were directly under a speaker, making it even worse. On the plus side, they were at least playing good music!    As for the food, the pizza was just "meh".  Five of us split the mob boss, which is a Sicilian style pizza. The menu said serves up to 5 people and it did for us girls, but if you're really hungry, I would say it's good for more like 3 people. The pizza comes in a big rectangular pan and has super thick crust. I feel like too many pieces had more crust than topping which was disappointing.   This place has just about every style of pizza one could dream of, so I'd be willing to try another kind. I'm sure there's got to be better pizzas than the Sicilian on the menu.

hP5U4Z8pAlCrvcp37LySvg.text: I'm always on the lookout for amazing pizza parlors, but this is not one of them.  The pizza was good, not great.  The variety of pizzas were outstanding, not sure if a more exotic pizza would have been a better choice.  Garlic bread was also just, okay.  Ambiance was hip. They are walking distance from Fremont Street and the Mob Museum, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

JfV_ukz1TvddFfFwsnnPZA.text: This might be my favorite pizza in Las Vegas. I've been here twice and am head over heels in love with the Ogden pizza. The mix of all the unique ingredients tastes like love in my mouth. I highly recommend trying it!

IDfKkhRlFm_5OAe5sdYNqQ.text: Jun. 2016- We are so tired of hunting down highly touted restaurants and being disappointed. I'm sure when some TV celebrity chef shows up with a film crew for a scheduled visit, the #1 cook prepares the food using the best super fresh ingredients possible. The resulting rating is often much better than what the man off the street is served. Not the case here. We ordered the award winning 16 inch New Yorker pizza...a slightly charred crust from a 700 degree oven topped with house made fennel sausage, a tasty pepperoni, mozzarella, garlic, a slightly sweet house made red sauce, and small dabs of cool ricotta. The sweetness of the sauce balanced perfectly with the spicy sausage and yielded a truly memorable pie. The fun, friendly service ( it's always fun to have a playfully humorous server ) added to our pizza experience. This pie is more than deserving of it's many accolades and will beckon us back every time we get a pizza craving.  Mar. 2018- We had to return based on the quality of our previous meal. Consistency is so important if a five star rating is to be rendered. The New Yorker Pie again performed to our expectations. One of our all time favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The New Yorker...

rr3XxXFzdpQPErCnBUYEnw.text: On the recommendation of family, we walked over to the Pizza Rock from the Golden Nugget.  Looked over the menu and noticed mostly specialty pizzas.  Not your everyday run in the mill pepperoni.  IMO, pizza starts with the crust.   This was the best crust I have ever had.  Homemade sauce, Homemade sausage w/fennel, roasted red peppers, mozzarella and spots of homemade ricotta.   Absolutely amazing flavors.  Never would have thunk it.  Another place we will return to.    The other is the Hash House A Go-Go. ( see my review)

MYn7PHXMRbBPfsaiK4iXLA.text: Great pizza. Horrible customer service. Idiot pizza cook was flirting with a customer instead of fulfilling my order... 5 min after ordering he put my pizza in. 10 min after I got it.  No tip. Would have tipped of he wasn't thinking with his crotch

kl2ty_sRF6IZ1Sn67wZ58Q.text: I'd heard super great things about this place and a pal of mine had done some online research and the name had come up in multiple spots so we were stoked to come here. Sadly, the pizza wasn't nearly as hype as I hoped.   They are known for their margherita pizza which is supposedly award winning and its kind of cool because they only make a limited number of those pies per day. However, when we got it there really wasn't all that much flavor to it. In fact the Picante that we had gotten far exceeded the taste.

A5v-FFYxeX5aHYctS3uLFQ.text: Classic New York pizza here is great !! I always drop by here when me and my family are in town . Would highly recommend if your looking for a nice pizza spot . Pricing is fair here .

NqiQyoMtIEPlMuwPNj-eXg.text: This place has very good pizza I ordered the New Yorker and it was amazing. I do think the bar could use some work my drink wasn't very good but the pizza is great and why I was there .

TAEbzcOVxcpiPAnw81ZZng.text: Extremely disappointed to write this however, my man ordered a fettuccine and Caesar salad. The sizing was for a toddler, just not enough food at all. The pasta has no flavor and didn't fulfill his hunger. There was no bread or anything the salad was miniature and basically just a bed of lettuce with a crouton on top. Now the part that really upset me was the fact his meal was 26$ for nothing. Long story short, SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO ELSEWHERE.

LSBbawh6w7dz5E5ahDDXjA.text: Poor customer service. No greeting at the door. Came in to pick up order for online customer associate standing at the counter talking to another associate store empty except for my order waiting for me to pick up. Didn't say hello or welcome to Pizza Rock when I walked in the door, just stared at me blankly and said what name? Is this the level of training with customer service that piece of Rock gives its customers????!

bwukMeCUVhqTqkgQxoWaKA.text: Wife and I grabbed two slices of Detroit Style from the take out window, we did not order from the sit-down restaurant part. Cmon man probably the best slice of pepperoni pizza i have had. Deep dish, Square cut with sauce on top goodness. Plus the guys at the take out window area were Awesome even tho they were busy busy busy. Large slices were about 6.50 each and worth every penny. Wanted to go back but the wife like variety so no more pizza for this trip :(

ba1U-4iSMpu-hdBwrqfxgA.text: I took 18 employees to lunch. My review is more focused on the group event than the foodie details.  We used their event room, which seats about 20 and has a big screen TV on one end. It's basically a rectangular space with two long tables open to the restaurant on one side. The TV is a distraction when you're having an event, but if it's turned off, the room might seem dark.  We left it on.  I made my reservation two days prior with Maddie, who handled it professionally. I received a confirmation call several hours ahead of our reservation, which was helpful. I didn't like that they won't allow you to submit your order in advance, even for a large group. I recommend allowing it if the client applies a deposit to ensure they show. I also think it would be great if they emailed group ordering suggestions in advance.  They do have pre-fix options for groups of 25 or larger.   I don't recommend taking a large group and just handing everyone a menu. When you take a horde somewhere, it helps to understand serving sizes and get recommendations. Unfortunately, their website was down on the day of the event, so I was operating blind. Hooray for Yelp!, where I found a partial menu, but the descriptions were inadequate for determining serving sizes.   If you're ordering pizza baked to order, there's no opportunity to quickly add pies if you come up short. I ordered seven 16-inch pizzas (mix of New Yorker, Michigan Ave and Frank Nitti). We also had 4 orders of garlic bread (6 large pieces) and four large salads that were shared. Garlic bread, salad and drinks kept everyone occupied until the pies arrived. Generally, their 13" pies serve two, 16" three and Giant Sicilian five. Specific pizzas only come in specific sizes, so pay attention.  The hostess greeting was lukewarm, but as soon as we were seated in the room, Summer (manager?) greeted me and discussed our needs. She reassured me my order was adequate to feed everyone and worked with my vegan colleague to help her understand meal options. Our servers were attentive, ensuring everyone's drinks were filled. The room was crowded, so there was a certain amount of passing things down, but that builds camaraderie.  Overall, good food, good service, good atmosphere and a satisfied client. Pricier than some competitors, but part of what you're paying for is the experience (there's a semi-truck in the dining room and you're in a tourist corridor). After tax and tip, we spent about $22 per person (no alcoholic beverages) and took about one pizza worth of food away in a box. There are opportunities to improve advance coordination for large groups. We would visit again.

-st4OlBZ47Ueye-C926hWw.text: If I could rate this a zero I would. Norma Jean (if that's even her name) was the absolute worst waitress. She rolled her eyes, rushed us and gave us horrible service. The pizza we got was burnt to a crisp and tasted like charcoal. When brought up to the manager she seemed very uninterested and just gave us our pizza free without caring about us. -10000/10 DO NOT COME HERE

Cl3aleoRYHt9yqShqv7e0A.text: If your looking for a place to relax and enjoy amazing pizza and beer this is the spot. Located just off Fremont St. this restaurant will not disappoint

YCO3Af9lGRyJFHYUzMf1nw.text: First time here and I must say, the "New Yorker" pizza on the menu is to die for! If you can't decide on a pizza, get this one! You won't regret it!  We also got a pizza with half pepperoni and half Americano. The pepperoni was basic but was still good.  And the Americano looked overwhelming at first with all the cherry tomatoes on it, but it was absolutely delicious! For 3 people, we got two pizzas and still had a few slices leftover to take home. Will have to come back to try all the other yummy items on the menu.   Word to the wise, prepare yourself for the traffic surrounding the area since it is close to all the Fremont street craziness.  We did valet at the parking garage across the street from the restaurant to the right (they work on tips). Or you can park your car and get your ticket validated at the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half pepperoni and half Americano.
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite pizza of all time!

T98RP5ubpucsVzJApRlXJg.text: Good food, family friendly, and good service. We really enjoyed it. Lots of unique pizza options.

4f2dtRUTCl1Oj0f7fqe6QA.text: I decided to try the lasagna at this place justifiably famous for its pizza. It wasn't the very best lasagna I ever had in my life, but it was darn close. Tangy sauce with strong tomato flavor. Delicious sausage and cheese in just the right amounts. Perfectly cooked pasta layers. Try it.

Q_J4GUzVsdj2QNE2waDSFA.text: Don't wait around if these two are working! Estimated 15 minutes then at 45 minutes estimated another 15 yet people that just walked in with the same amount of people needed to be seated are seated....then another 15 minutes and still was not seated.  Been here since it opened and have always had a good experience with friendly staff and delicious food. Sadly tonight we walked out without being seated or any slices to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. People who cannot estimate....

9eEKYbA7i0GL1bDqH6VbyA.text: The Americano pizza is to die for!!!  So tasty and the staff is very prompt and courteous. Definitely a place to try when in Las Vegas!!

5EwXwZn0WXLpaebUGvFcbg.text: Took a trip to Vegas and stayed in the California. This place is a few blocks away and is awesome!!! The vibe is laid back and good service. They got my order wrong but the manager was right on it. The pizza is awesome!!! Have no complaints about this place. We will be back

_x9yNLK9E0vZCp-GJInkQw.text: I'm a fan.  I love how they have a ton of different types of pizza on the menu.  So you can bring a group of people who are craving different styles,  and all of you will be happy! I've tried several pizzas here and I have to say that the crust is amazing on all of them,  no matter which kind you get.   They have a variety of appetizers,  and some main dishes if you aren't interested in pizza.  I recommend the meatballs if you're looking for a quick bite.    The thing I'm most happy about is the Beer list.  Pizza and Beer are just meant to go together,  and with such a variety in their pizza,  they need to have a variety in their beer... and boy do they! So many great brews on draft,  and an excellent bottle selection.    One thing about this location I would change is the dining room ambiance.  The Bar is... Ok,  but the dining room feels like you're in a cheap food court,  and believe me this isn't cheap pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Yorker pizza.  Excellent!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs

848a-zgWI6m2PvS5DxHerA.text: If you can get past the Ed Hardy look of this place you will be treated to some very fine offerings.  (I honestly did not have high hopes and I am sorry for that!)  Started out with an appetizer (not on the online menu) - it was fried dough with burrata and crispy prosciutto. Holy heck was this amazing. I could have eaten three orders of this myself and been happy. But then the pizza arrived and it was the Sausage Stout Pizza (Honey Malted Dough Made with Stout Beer, Fresh Mozzarella, House Made Beer Sausage, Caramelized Onions, Fontina, Green Onions, Crushed Red Peppers, Beer Salt & a Sweet Stout Beer Reduction). And WOW if you thought the description was good the execution was even better. Glad to have found this place and if I am ever back in Las Vegas you can be sure I will be back here.

kuAtzlLCJ7BhZvHFhbSIkw.text: I was really going to give this place 4 stars due to the horribly rude hostess staff and poor dining service - BUT the manager Colin made it a 5 star experience.  They have happy hour from 10p-2a, so I don't think I'll ever go anywhere else for food on Fremont. The hosts up front would not acknowledge me and my two friends, it was oddly difficult to get a table at midnight even though the restaurant wasn't busy.  My friend ordered a calzone and when they brought it out, they apologized all of the toppings went to one side and the other half was just an empty hole. They allowed her to still eat the other half while they made a new one. Colin came by and said 5 minutes and the new one is ready. He then came back 10 minutes later and apologized they burned her calzone so now they're making another new one. My friend asked for it to-go, as we've now been eating and drinking for 45 minutes and we were ready to leave. Colin came back again, said 5 more minutes, and then returned 10 minutes later and said he comped her food and her drinks due to the calzone issue. 15 minutes later she got the calzone to go and it was all on the house.  If it wasn't for Colin continually checking on us and giving us an update, it would definitely of kept the 4 stars. I had a personal size happy hour pizza and it was delish! My other friend order a Carmel Apple martini, which was way too strong for her, but all of our food and drinks tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cal Italia Pizza

A166Ihq3CXvZlXuA0UqZiA.text: I don't know if I would of sought this restaurant out but I am glad it was easily discoverable being its located across the street from the hotel I was staying at. My first visit was a planned luncheon with a few business associates, the second visit was to enjoy the late night pizzeria option they run after normal business hours. Located in a section of town where the alcohol flow-rate exceeds the measurable annual rainfall totals makes these types of restaurants welcoming places of refuge after spending the night getting the "Fremont" experience on and the line out the door validates this type of business model is a no-brainer.  Well you don't comes here only because you've tried to consume all the beer and all the generous pours of alcohol from the vendors lining Fremont Street or if you've participated in the legal cannabis craze. They do stand pretty tall when it comes to food quality and options here and the service was outstanding during both of my visits. The house salad with their house dressing is pretty special I'd recommend it with any order - I also tried the meatballs on a sub roll and also as an appetizer they are definitely something to consider and in regards to the late night pizzeria options this pizza definitely elevates their notoriety. The re-heat is executed perfectly but in actuality the number of customers turned here late night keeps the pizzas moving from the oven to the plate and I saw nothing that appeared to be aging past it's prime...

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mgQAFohneV_GrNnw77oqUQ.text: We went in after a short walk in old Vegas strip. We ordered the house salad, a veggie pizza and the mud pie.  Starting with the service - top notch. Definitely earning their tips here ;)  The house salad was a generous portion but almost all of it was lettuce and other greens. We expected a bit more tomatoes and onions etc.  The pizza was the star of the dinner. The crust was just perfect. You can most definitely notice the 900 degrees oven. Just great. The tomato sauce can be improved a bit though.  For dessert we ordered the mud pie. It was delicious. Quite similar to the cheesecake factory cakes (it's a rather heavy cake).

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mud pie

_fjWdulFgkLasaJmkJCErw.text: We wanted to try this place since seeing it on food network. Just like all of the others plaves that we have tried we were disappointed.   We ordered the New York which the waitress messed up out order so we decided to have the pizza remade. When it came out there was so much sauce which normally would be ok, but it was so sweet I tried to scrape some off. There was 4- 5 clumps of cheese and the crusts was burnt. I can't believe they charged $25 for an awful pizza.

HtXKsziXkmgmF5SFedkMJA.text: Great late night stop for Italian food!!! If was right across the street from our hotel which was awesome!!! We really were hungry for pizza! They have an area in the front of the restaurant that you can order a slice and a beer to go or you can sit inside the restaurant for a lovely meal with the full menu option.   We ordered off the late night Happy Hour specials which were so reasonable! We started with eggplants strips and meatballs and each ordered 6" personal pizzas. We each ordered a drink and ate till we got our second wind!   The food was fantastic! Our waiter was awesome and the atmosphere was relaxing! I will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and sausage!!!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant strips!!!
Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cal Italia Pizza! Excellent!!!

EwOPqhJdwfGZWuuC9hc4Lg.text: I'd put this place in the top three pizza joints in LV. Honestly, with the amount of options on their menu, they may be the best overall. I don't even know where to start. The location is great, the ambiance is cool, the service is on point and the food... Our bill was pretty high because there were four of us and we all ordered different stuff so we could try as much as possible. Everything that was delivered to us was outstanding. The pizza crust was crispy, but chewy, which is the only way to be as a pizza crust. The toppings were plentiful and had their own distinct flavors. We have sent out of town friends there when they have asked for pizza recommendations in town and they have all raved about it. Unless you site Domino's pizza as your favorite pizza, which indicates that you have the palate of a toddler, you will find something you love at this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WXgYWY3eLOqLHDK5ayiC2Q.text: Had brunch today at Pizza rock. We were a party of five and were seated right away.   The hostess greeted us with a smile .   They had a gentleman who was singing and playing guitar.  It was a great touch.  He was awesome.  I love the decor it's very rustic and really fun!   Especially the semi truck that's actually a DJ booth.  We ordered pizza and brunch food and as an appetizer garlic string beans.  Oh bottomless mimosas today for $15!   The only reason they didn't get five stars is everyone received there food and were done eating and then I received mine.  I didn't order anything special actually the same thing as one other person I was with.   Our waitress was wonderful and I will definitely be returning !!   Great place to eat and it's lots of fun

FXFAYaOFj5iLUKXKOaaE9g.text: After bouncing back and forth between fancy fine dining meals and over priced cabana food, it was very refreshing to have a delicious meal at an affordable price! I think it's partly due to the fact that we finally trekked down to Fremont street and away from all the big casinos! I highly recommended going down there even just for a few hours! Pizza rock came recommended by our Uber driver, it also sounded delicious, and sure enough as we walk towards the doors I get that quintessential pizza parlor smell that comes wafting at me! The perfect smell of the best parlor pizza is awaiting inside!! The pizza was great, the beers were great and our waiter was awesome, whenever we make it back to Vegas I'm definitely coming back to Fremont street for more 5 dollar blackjack, fun people watching and killer pizza from pizza rock!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Rock - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese pie with extra mushrooms

anCUMxYL5kO3O7jGMzue7g.text: No matter why you are in Vegas for but you need to visit this place and get the taste of the most delicious pizza in the world!!
